title: please help!
content:
hi, i’m preparing some flyers for my little brother’s soccer team and am trying to clean up these 2 logos, but i couldn’t figure out what type had been used.. thanks in advance!

p.s. i think the second one is helvetica neue..  
maybe like 77bold condensed but not sure

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logo\_ayso-promotional.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026093853/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_ayso-promotional.jpg) | 5.26 KB |
| [logo\_ayso-playsoccer.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026093853/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_ayso-playsoccer.jpg) | 4.59 KB |

 [‹ (x) Squarish slab serif address - Cholla Slab {Andrew J Sipe}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026093853/http:/typophile.com/node/42488 "Go to previous forum topic") [Architype Fonts Found ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026093853/http:/typophile.com/node/12492 "Go to next forum topic")
author: carlalove

comments.content:
PLAYSOCCER looks like Helvetica 77, maybe 87, but I can’t really tell because of the low resolution, and if this is the resolution of the logo, I doubt anyone will be able to tell if you change the font slightly. Also, I couldn’t find this logo in use online in the Google searches, so maybe nobody even knows it exists.

I don’t think it really makes sense to do much to the other logo as it’s the official logo. If nobody can figure out the font, you could play with a higher-resolution version of that official logo, like the one [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081026093853/http:/www.aysostore.com/)
